benchmark_details.name: Systematic Evaluation Framework for Code-Switched Text
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a systematic evaluation framework that generates linguistically grounded code-switched variants of established benchmarks in reading comprehension, multi-domain knowledge, and natural language inference to assess the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate LLM comprehension under code-switching and to fill gaps in assessing deeper reasoning and semantic understanding in mixed-language settings.

data.source: Generated code-switched variants of existing benchmarks

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is defined as a function of the number of correct predictions over total predictions on the benchmark dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Positive accuracy delta indicates improvement under code-switching; lower accuracy indicates processing challenges.
methodology.validation: Evaluation utilizes a set of benchmark tasks adapted to include code-switching.
